TrcCommonLib.trclib

Class TrcDbgTrace

  • java.lang.Object
    • TrcCommonLib.trclib.TrcDbgTrace

  • public class TrcDbgTrace
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the Debug Tracer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  TrcDbgTrace.DbgLog
      This interface provides a platform independent way to write to the debug log.
      static class  TrcDbgTrace.MsgLevel
      This enum specifies the different debug message levels.
      static class  TrcDbgTrace.TraceLevel
      This enum specifies the different debug tracing levels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrcDbgTrace

        public TrcDbgTrace(java.lang.String instanceName,
                   boolean traceEnabled,
                   TrcDbgTrace.TraceLevel traceLevel,
                   TrcDbgTrace.MsgLevel msgLevel)
        Constructor: Create an instance of the object.
        Parameters:
        instanceName - specifies the instance name.
        traceEnabled - specifies true to enable debug tracing, false to disable.
        traceLevel - specifies the trace level.
        msgLevel - specifies the message level.

    • Method Detail

      • setDbgLog

        public static void setDbgLog(TrcDbgTrace.DbgLog dbgLog)
        This static method must be called to set the DbgLog object before any TrcDbgTrace can be instantiated.
        Parameters:
        dbgLog - specifies the dbgLog object to be set.

      • getGlobalTracer

        public static TrcDbgTrace getGlobalTracer()
        This method returns a global debug trace object for tracing OpMode code. If it doesn't exist yet, one is created. This is an easy way to quickly get some debug output without a whole lot of setup overhead as the full module-based debug tracing.
        Returns:
        global opMode trace object.

      • setGlobalTracerConfig

        public static void setGlobalTracerConfig(boolean traceEnabled,
                                         TrcDbgTrace.TraceLevel traceLevel,
                                         TrcDbgTrace.MsgLevel msgLevel)
        This method sets the global tracer configuration. The OpMode trace object was created with default configuration of disabled method tracing, method tracing level is set to API and message trace level set to INFO. Call this method if you want to change the configuration.
        Parameters:
        traceEnabled - specifies true if enabling method tracing.
        traceLevel - specifies the method tracing level.
        msgLevel - specifies the message tracing level.

      • openTraceLog

        public boolean openTraceLog(java.lang.String traceLogName)
        This method opens a log file for writing all the trace messages to it.
        Parameters:
        traceLogName - specifies the full trace log file path name.
        Returns:
        true if log file is successfully opened, false if it failed.

      • openTraceLog

        public boolean openTraceLog(java.lang.String folderPath,
                            java.lang.String fileName)
        This method opens a log file for writing all the trace messages to it. The log file is written to the specified folder. The file name will be formed by concatenating the date-time stamp with the specified file name.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - specifies the folder path.
        fileName - specifies the file name, null if none provided.
        Returns:
        true if log file is successfully opened, false if it failed.

      • closeTraceLog

        public void closeTraceLog()
        This method closes the trace log file.

      • tracerLogIsOpened

        public boolean tracerLogIsOpened()
        This method checks if the tracer log is opened.
        Returns:
        true if tracer log is opened, false otherwise.

      • getTraceLogName

        public java.lang.String getTraceLogName()
        This method returns the trace log file name if one is active.
        Returns:
        trace log file name if one is active, null if none.

      • setTraceLogEnabled

        public void setTraceLogEnabled(boolean enabled)
        This method enables/disables the trace log.
        Parameters:
        enabled - specifies true to enable trace log, false otherwise.

      • setDbgTraceConfig

        public void setDbgTraceConfig(boolean traceEnabled,
                              TrcDbgTrace.TraceLevel traceLevel,
                              TrcDbgTrace.MsgLevel msgLevel)
        This method sets the trace level, message level of the debug tracer. It can also enables/disables function tracing.
        Parameters:
        traceEnabled - specifies true to enable function tracing, false to disable.
        traceLevel - specifies the trace level.
        msgLevel - specifies the message level.

      • logInfo

        public void logInfo(java.lang.String funcName,
                    java.lang.String infoName,
                    java.lang.String format,
                    java.lang.Object... args)
        This method logs a MsgLevel.INFO entry that contains information about the match. The entry is in XML format and is intended to be parsed by tools such as TrcTraceLogVisualizer.
        Parameters:
        funcName - specifies the calling method name.
        infoName - specifies the name to identify the information.
        format - specifies the format string of the message.
        args - specifies the message arguments.

      • logEvent

        public void logEvent(java.lang.String funcName,
                     java.lang.String eventName,
                     java.lang.String format,
                     java.lang.Object... args)
        This method logs a MsgLevel.INFO entry that contains an event. The entry is in XML format and is intended to be parsed by tools such as TrcTraceLogVisualizer.
        Parameters:
        funcName - specifies the calling method name.
        eventName - specifies the name to identify the event.
        format - specifies the format string of the message.
        args - specifies the message arguments.

      • traceStateInfo

        public void traceStateInfo(java.lang.Object state,
                           TrcDriveBase driveBase,
                           TrcPidDrive pidDrive,
                           TrcRobotBattery battery)
        This method logs a state info event using the global tracer. The state info event can be used to debug an autonomous state machine. If the state involves PID controlled driving, it also logs the robot's movement.
        Parameters:
        state - specifies the current state of the state machine.
        driveBase - specifies the robot drive base, can be null if the state does not involve robot movement.
        pidDrive - specifies the pidDrive object, can be null if the state does not involve robot movement.
        battery - specifies the robot battery object, can be null if not interested in battery info.

      • traceStateInfo

        public void traceStateInfo(java.lang.Object state,
                           TrcDriveBase driveBase,
                           TrcPidDrive pidDrive)
        This method logs a state info event. The state info event can be used to debug an autonomous state machine. If the state involves PID controlled driving, it also logs the robot's movement.
        Parameters:
        state - specifies the current state of the state machine.
        driveBase - specifies the robot drive base, can be null if the state does not involve robot movement.
        pidDrive - specifies the pidDrive object, can be null if the state does not involve robot movement.

      • traceStateInfo

        public void traceStateInfo(java.lang.Object state,
                           TrcRobotBattery battery)
        This method logs a state info event. The state info event can be used to debug an autonomous state machine.
        Parameters:
        state - specifies the current state of the state machine.
        battery - specifies the robot battery object, can be null if not interested in battery info.

      • traceStateInfo

        public void traceStateInfo(java.lang.Object state)
        This method logs a state info event. The state info event can be used to debug an autonomous state machine.
        Parameters:
        state - specifies the current state of the state machine.

      • traceEnter

        public void traceEnter(java.lang.String funcName,
                       TrcDbgTrace.TraceLevel funcLevel,
                       java.lang.String format,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
        This method is typically called at the beginning of a method to trace the entry parameters of the method.
        Parameters:
        funcName - specifies the calling method name.
        funcLevel - specifies the trace level.
        format - specifies the format string of the message.
        args - specifies the message arguments.

                       TrcDbgTrace.TraceLevel funcLevel)
        This method is typically called at the beginning of a method.
        Parameters:
        funcName - specifies the calling method name.
        funcLevel - specifies the trace level.

        public void traceExit(java.lang.String funcName,
                      TrcDbgTrace.TraceLevel funcLevel,
                      java.lang.String format,
                      java.lang.Object... args)
        This method is typically called at the end of a method to trace the return value of the method.
        Parameters:
        funcName - specifies the calling method name.
        funcLevel - specifies the trace level.
        format - specifies the format string of the message.
        args - specifies the message arguments.

        funcLevel - specifies the trace level.

                         java.lang.String format,

        This method is called to print a verbose message.
        Parameters:
        funcName - specifies the calling method name.
        format - specifies the format string of the message.
        args - specifies the message arguments.

      • traceInfoAtInterval

        public void traceInfoAtInterval(java.lang.String funcName,
                                TrcIntervalTimer timer,
                                java.lang.String format,
                                java.lang.Object... args)
        This method is called to print a message only if the given interval timer has expired since the last periodic message. This is useful to print out periodic status without overwhelming the debug console.
        Parameters:
        funcName - specifies the calling method name.
        timer - specifies the interval timer.
        format - specifies the format string of the message.
        args - specifies the message arguments.

      • tracePrintf

        public void tracePrintf(java.lang.String format,
                        java.lang.Object... args)
        This method prints a debug message to the debug console.
        Parameters:
        format - specifies the format string of the message.
        args - specifies the message arguments.
